item.title: Report X-2024010578
item.description:
Report X-2024010578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-25T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO THE HAZMAT CLEARK STATION. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW IT WAS AN OXIDIZER CORROSIVE, RESPONDER USED PPE AND REFERRED TO DECISION TREE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE TOP DIAMOND LABEL WHICH WAS THE OXIDIZER TO CLEAN UP AND CONTAIN THE SPILL. RESPONDER TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024010385
item.description:
Report X-2024010385

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: IMPORT PACKAGE FROM TURKEY WAS INSPECTED BY US CUSTOMS OFFICIALS WHO DISCOVERED DANGEROUS GOODS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED 102 INNER SMALL BOX MATCHES. EACH SMALL MATCHBOX CONTAINS 25 MATCHES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. CUSTOMS INVOICE AND THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIBE THE CONTENTS AS HOME DECOR. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 8937F6, QS MIKRO DAGITIM AS, SERIFALI MAH.EMIN SK.HEY PLAZA BLOK NO:51-7, UMRANIYE-ISTANBUL TURKEY 34000.

item.title: Report X-2024010481
item.description:
Report X-2024010481

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-23T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY, RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE GOING TO HAWAII THAT WAS BEING REPACKED AFTER BEING WET FROM RAINWATER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 5.25 KG PLASTIC TUB OF CORROSIVE RATIONAL CLEANER TABS. THE INNER PLASTIC CONTAINER HAS A BLACK AND WHITE LIMITED QUANTITY MARK IMPRINTED ON THE CONTAINER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW YORK USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 150479, KEREKES BAKERY EQUIP, 6103 15TH AVE., BROOKLYN NY 11219-5402.

item.title: Report E-2024010359
item.description:
Report E-2024010359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported there was a drum with moisture on the outside on the dock in Louisville, KY. It is a 55 gallon metal drum containing Primary Amel Acetate, which was found on the dock "sweating" but with no signs of visible damage on the container. The caller stated there was no active leak. The drum was not packaged correctly. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they overpacked the drum in an 85 gallon poly drum and it was left in the waste area to be managed by the terminal.
